      • getSocket

        public static java.net.Socket getSocket(java.lang.String machineName,
                        int port,
                        int numAttempts,
                        java.lang.String infoOnError)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Open a socket. We have all socket opening go through this method so that we can keep track. Callers have the option of specifying multiple attempts.
        Parameters:
        machineName - Name of target machine
        port - Port to connect to at target machine
        numAttempts - Number of times a connection attempt is to be made
        infoOnError - String to use in error messages. Messages generated with this method will automatically add the machine name and port in parentheses. So this information is not required in this parameter.
        Returns:
        An open socket.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getSocket

        public static java.net.Socket getSocket(java.net.InetAddress iPAddr,
                        int port,
                        int numAttempts,
                        java.lang.String infoOnError)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        iPAddr - IP address object of target machine.
        port - port Port to connect to at target machine
        numAttempts - numAttempts Number of times a connection attempt is to be made
        infoOnError - infoOnError String to use in error messages. Messages generated with this method will automatically add the machine name and port in parentheses. So this information is not required in this parameter.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        getSocket(String machineName, int port, int numAttempts, String infoOnError)
